p: The application of multiple adaptation modeling methods across different climate change impact studies means that there is no clear understanding of the relative effects that each method can have on the impacts. Nor is there a recommendation of what method is most appropriate for application ( Huang et al. 2011). This problem is compounded by the general lack of rationale for the adaptation methods chosen in past studies. Some methods have been used more frequently than others: for example, absolute threshold shifts ( Table 1), perhaps because they are more straightforward to apply than some of the other methods.
